channel.title: Next language
channel.description:
Okay, so I've been considering learning another language for quite some time now and I think it's time to actually do it. I've had a few ideas in my head on what I want to do but I truly don't know the ins and outs of the languages.
I should probably state that I in no way want to go into a career in programming and it's completely recreational.
So what would you recommend? I already know PHP through and through and I'm looking at either Ruby or C++. I've heard Ruby's a great language and it's good to know but nothing can touch C++ benchmark wise(so I've heard). C++ is also supposedly a massive jump from a shitty language such as PHP.
Suggestions please?

item.title: Next language
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

C# obviously.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Next language
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

p.s: consider django if you plan on doing web dev in python.

Read full topic

item.title: Next language
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:21, topic:465171”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=569922.msg4131858#msg4131858 date=1351196375]
anything Java can do Ruby can do it better.
[/quote]What a silly thing to say lol

TIL - Ruby is better at being a bad language than Java is[/quote]

I was merely regurgitating something sinisoul had said in the past and several others agreed with him.

[quote=“Agent766, post:20, topic:465171”]I use a lot of Lua with Garry’s Mod. It really comes down to what you want to do. C++ is great for gaming because it’s low(er) level and you have complete control over what you’re doing.

Personally, I love Java for it’s syntax and C# for the .NET library. It’s incredibly powerful.

Now scripting is another ballpark. It mostly comes down to syntax, whichever you prefer. I’ve messed around with a bit of Ruby, Javascript, Lua, Python, and some other stuff. Personally, I like Lua the most. I think it’s pretty clever how OOP isn’t an explicit part of the language. It evolved out of it’s flexibility.[/quote]

Whackatre told me to take a look at Lua and I actually liked it quite a lot, however; I’ve decided to go with ruby at the minute and if I’m still into programming I’ll hit onto C++.

RiiPiiNFtW:

If you want to do more scientific things with programming, try NetLogo. Simulations on that are fun and its a Java based language.

I’ve never even heard of that if I’m honest, I’ll take a look at some documentation though.

Read full topic

item.title: Next language
item.dc:creator: @Agent766 Agent766
item.description:
@Agent766 wrote:

I use a lot of Lua with Garry’s Mod. It really comes down to what you want to do. C++ is great for gaming because it’s low(er) level and you have complete control over what you’re doing.

Personally, I love Java for it’s syntax and C# for the .NET library. It’s incredibly powerful.

Now scripting is another ballpark. It mostly comes down to syntax, whichever you prefer. I’ve messed around with a bit of Ruby, Javascript, Lua, Python, and some other stuff. Personally, I like Lua the most. I think it’s pretty clever how OOP isn’t an explicit part of the language. It evolved out of it’s flexibility.

Read full topic

item.title: Next language
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:8, topic:465171”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=569922.msg4131859#msg4131859 date=1351196525]

I always thought your name was Ruby because it was like your first language or something, guess not lol. Personally I’d prefer C++ over Ruby, only because I’m interested in game development.

My first and only language is PHP. I like C++ and I’d happily learn it but like I said in the OP it’s apparently a huge jump from something like PHP, have you learned any?

I wrote a hello world app in it lol, it’s a decent jump from Java, but similar in some ways. I just know C++ is the main language that many Windows games are written in today, which is why I’d like to eventually learn it, there just isn’t any big communities for it like there are for Java. Not open source type communities, like this one.
[/quote]

Yeah I was screwing around with string manipulation in C++ today and it just seemed like a magnificent jump from PHP. If I was really interested in game development then I’d definitely look into C++, you should maybe try and learn more of it while you’re younger so it’s easier when you’re older.

I’ve also been looking at Python, opinions people?[/quote]
I’ve seen some amazing things done in Python, it’s worth the try.

Read full topic
